column3: Hardcoding it is wrong for systems other than windows.  If it's missing on OpenBSD it may be necessary to add another header.  select.h would be an obvious candidate.
FD_SETSIZE has historically been able to be overridden on most systems, but unfortunately IIRC some years ago glibc hard-coded it so it cannot be changed. :(

ACK after squash. Adding a header is the right thing to do.\n\nI wonder why you need this though, I have built many times on OpenBSD (https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/build-openbsd.md) without stumbling on this issue.
I started using OpenBSD again after some time. I upgraded to -current and followed the instructions in build-openbsd.md and got the error that FD_SETSIZE was undeclared.
